title: 820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
message:
After multiple attempts

Every time I click on erase , it is loading back asking for user id password or Iclould.  I don't have either.

First Type C port:  It takes 20 V in but doesn't boot up

Second Type C port : It works fine

title: 820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
message:
It is not getting connected in DFU mode

as I mentioned Port 1, which is close to LCD is taking 20 V but not taking ampere, not booting system

title: 820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
message: The other port (close to trackpad) is for DFU...

title: 820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
message:

and now I wanna say that I Tried from that port ,which is close to trackpad, as well. It is not going into DFU Mode.

title: 820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
message: So machine starts and you can get in recovery mode in one port?

title: 820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
message: Do you have the option Erase Mac in Recovery Assistant?

title: 820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
message: When I click on it....It restarts and launch the internet recovery mode, and then It circle back to same Recovery Assistant page

title: 820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
message:
Did you exactly follow all steps in DFU tutorial?
Sometime takes time and many tries, to get into DFU mode.

Can you access Disk Utility?
Try to put the machine in Target Disk mode and access its SSD from other Mac.

title: 820 01521 :  Unable to erase the MacBook air
message:
How to do it ? Try to put the machine in Target Disk mode and access its SSD from other Mac.

I got another macbook pro 2018 with the same issue
